revised_title: Instabilities and Oscillations in Chemical Reactions: A Review of Models and Applications
tldr: This lecture discusses the study of isothermal oscillations in homogeneous chemical systems, focusing on the development of self-consistent models that satisfy basic physical principles. The author presents the autocatalator model, which combines an autocatalytic step with catalyst decay, and explores its applications in closed and open systems. The lecture also covers the importance of preserving matter conservation in chemical reactions and the use of open systems for oscillatory behavior.
